project.teaser: Heating and cooling in buildings and industry accounts for half of the EU’s energy consumption, making it the biggest energy end-use sector ahead of both, transport and electricity. Approximately 75% of heating and cooling is still generated from fossil fuels while only 22%...
project.objective: Heating and cooling in buildings and industry accounts for half of the EU’s energy consumption, making it the biggest energy end-use sector ahead of both, transport and electricity. Approximately 75% of heating and cooling is still generated from fossil fuels while only 22% is generated from renewable energy. District heating and cooling networks supplied by renewable energy sources can be a solution to all these issues, offering a clean, energy-efficient, and cost-effective alternative to individual fossil-fuel heating systems. Geothermal energy has the potential to play a vital role inside heating and cooling networks by offering zero emission stable base load supply and heat storage in the subsurface. Still, geothermal energy supplied heating and cooling networks (‘geoHC networks’) cover a small niche of around 1% inside the European heating and cooling sector, which is a result of primarily non-technological market barriers. SAPHEA addresses the uptake of multivalent heating and cooling networks supplied by geothermal energy by creating a durable digital market uptake hub. The hub contains toolboxes and guidelines to support stakeholders in early stage investment decisions and strategy planning activities and addresses market actors in districts or municipalities all across Europe. SAPHEA will therefore combine, adapt and expand existing tools (e.g., Hotmaps or EnerMaps) considering a set of market ready and emerging technological concepts linked to geoHC networks. The users of the hub, represented by local authorities, community services and energy suppliers will be empowered by targeted trainings to draft development scenarios and roadmaps taking into consideration the specific geological and socio-economic boundary conditions in their respective region. Dedicated communication activities will lead to the establishment to a lively network around the market uptake hub of public and private market actors as well as researchers beyond the lifetime of SAPHEA.
project.title: Developing a single access point for the market uptake of geothermal energy use in multivalent heating and cooling networks across Europe
project.keywords: Geothermal energy, heating and cooling networks, market uptakes, single access point consultancy hub

article.title: Increasing the adoption of geothermal heating and cooling

result.title: White book of the spatial dataset related toolbox
result.description: The White Book will contain a brief description of the planned functionalities and contents of the decision support toolbox. It will also refer to assessed user requirements and contains a preliminary general data management plan.Task 3.1 will be summarized in this White paper

result.title: Status report on the socio-environmental conditions for the implementation of geoHC networks in Europe
result.description: The report will be divided in 3 parts: 1. social readiness evaluation scheme and its application in the study areas; 2. identifying sustainability criteria in the context of geoHC networks; 3. expected social and environmental impacts of a massive rollout of geoHC networks in Europe.Task 5.2 and Task 5.3

result.title: Status quo report on regulatory and policy framework in the context of geoHC networks in Europe
result.description: The report will introduce and describe the political readiness level evaluation scheme and exhibits its application on the study areas. It will also summarize key aspects of the current European regulatory and policy framework and outlines existing gaps and shortcomings as well as already available good practices.Task 5.1

result.title: Summary report on the development and testing of the toolbox in the study areas
result.description: The executed adaptions and further developments based on pre-existing open-source tools, executed in this project, will be summarized in a publicly accessible report. This report will also include feedback and lessons learned section from testing and evaluating in the study areas.Task 3.3 and Task 3.4

result.title: PROJEKT HORYZONT EUROPA SAPHEA – WIĘCEJ GEOTERMII W SIECIACH CIEPŁOWNICZYCH!

details.authors: Hajto Marek, Ciapala Bartolomiej, Halaj Elzibieta

result.title: Summary report on capacity-building activities
result.description: This report will cover a summary of all capacity building activities as well as an impact assessment and a lessons-learned section for future uptake. The report will be complemented with an electronic document repository hosting the documentation and materials used for capacity building.Task 6.3

result.title: Digital Market Uptake Hub
result.description: This web portal, adapted from the COST Action CA18219, will represent the core output of WP7 and offer the digital environment for all tools and products developed in SAPHEA. It will include geographical tools (GIS-based interactive map of characterized good practices, decision support and strategic planning toolbox), consultancy applications (electronic guidelines, fact sheets of geoHC networks) and a knowledge and document repository.Task 7.3 and Task 2.5 will feed into this deliverable

result.title: Data management plan including metadata catalogues
result.description: All spatial datasets used in the toolbox will be accompanied by a data management plan to ensure compliance with FAIR principles, including metadata descriptions. The data management plan and its electronic annexes will have a metadata catalogue linked to the final version of the document repository, part of the Market Uptake Hub (D 7.2).Task 1.3

result.title: Catalogue of spatial datasets including data preparation guidelines and protocols
result.description: The report will include a description of produced datasets and methodological guidelines for input data preparation. The datasets created will be added to the report as a digital annexes and provided to EuroGeoSurveys for publishing at the European Geological Data Infrastructure (EGDI).Task 2.3 and Task 2.4

result.title: Roadmaps towards better integration of geoHC networks in Europe
result.description: Individual development and scenarios created by stakeholders in the involved study areas will be analyzed and compiled towards a summarizing roadmap for future market uptakes. This deliverable will addresse policymakers at a European and regional scale to raise awareness and educate on possible future market uptake and contributions of geoHC networks to the decarbonization of the European HC sector.Task 6.5

result.title: Summary report of personal, hybrid and online events organized and supported by SAPHEA
result.description: The report will summarize and concludes all events linked to the project, complemented by an electronic repository with detailed documentation of activities. Events presentations, summary reports and recordings will also be available at the CSA-related website and social media channels.Task 7.2

result.title: Summary report on scientific dissemination measures
result.description: All scientific dissemination measures will be summarized in a concluding report, which is complemented by an electronic archive of all individual contributions (presentations, articles including the special journal).Task 7.4

result.title: Heating and cooling supply scenario catalogue in the context of proven and future technological concepts
result.description: This catalogue will provide the basis for designing and developing the products of work packages WP3 to WP5, characterizing all concepts addressed in the project.Task 2.2 link to Task 6.2

result.title: Status report on business models relevant for geoHC networks
result.description: This report will portray the current status of sustainable business models for geoHC networks and will provide the basis for developing the blueprints and recommendations (T4.3).Task 4.1

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - SAPHEA (Developing a single access point for the market uptake of geothermal energy use in multivalent heating and cooling networks across Europe)
result.description: periodic
result.teaser: The SAPHEA project addresses the EU's need for a sustainable energy transition, focusing on the heating and cooling (HC) sector, which consumes half of the EU’s energy and relies on fossil fuels. Transitioning to geothermal energy within district heating and cooling networks...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Blueprints of financial mechanisms relevant for geoHC networks
result.description: This report will identify standard blueprints for financing geoHC networks, applicable to all regions of the EU.Task 4.4

result.title: Data Management plan - first revision
result.description: All spatial datasets used in the toolbox will be accompanied by a data management plan to ensure compliance with FAIR principles. The first revision of the DMP will present the identified data structure and offer templates for filling the metadata catalogue during the project.Task 1.3

result.title: Summary report on early-stage stakeholder interaction
result.description: This report will summarize the performed activities and conclusions drawn on user requirements and needs related to knowledge gaps. The report will also contain recommendations for the design of the Market Uptake Hub (contribution to milestone M3) and will be complemented by an electronic repository on the documentation and materials used for the stakeholder interaction.Task 6.2

result.title: Status report on financial mechanisms/schemes relevant for geoHC networks
result.description: This report will offer a review of currently available financing mechanisms for geoHC networks, providing the basis for developing the blueprints and recommendations (T4.4).Task 4.2

result.title: Blueprints of business models relevant for geoHC networks
result.description: This report will design standard sustainable business models, applicable to all EU, with regional recommendations to boost market uptake of geoHC networks.Task 4.3

result.title: Interactive digital guideline (“gamebook”) to support the Market Uptake Hub
result.description: The intuitive gamebook-style guideline will combinefact sheets and self-assessment questionnaires on early stage decision-making to plan and implement geoHC networks. It will capitalize on the outcomes of the thematic work packages in an easily digestible format and links to the tools of the Market Uptake Hub.Task 6.4

result.title: Status report on key market drivers related to the implementation of geoHC networks
result.description: This summary report will position the current situation and expected trends linked to geoHC networks. The report also outlines critical success criteria and KPIs for supporting future market uptake.Task 2.1 and linked to Task 6.2

result.title: Open-source toolbox for early-stage investment decision support and strategic planning
result.description: The toolbox will cover a chain of different routines and applications to enable techno-, sustainability as well as socio-economic option analyses for the implementation of geoHC networks across Europe related to geographical datasets (NUTS 3 to NUTS 1 level). By default, new datasets developed in the project will cover the entirety of Europe at limited spatial resolutions. However, the toolbox will offer import functions to use local data in a higher spatial resolution by users. The toolbox will be based on open-source codes and will be openly accessible. It will constitute a crucial product in the Market Uptake Hub.Task 3.3. and task 3.4

result.title: Science to policy report on recommended measures towards a supportive regulatory and policy framework
result.description: This document, in a position paper style, will contain a comprehensive set of recommendations addressing regulatory, social perception, participative, and sustainability aspects for policymakers from a regional to a European level. The report will also include suggestions for harmonizing regional to national policies to support EU legislation in the context of geo HC networks. The document will be available in English and national languages, at least for the countries participating in the consortium.Task 5.4

category.title: geothermal energy
category.displayCode: /engineering and technology/environmental engineering/energy and fuels/renewable energy/geothermal energy

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
